docstr:
`UNLINK` â€” Remove a file from the file system ### Description Unlinks the file `PATH`. A null character (`CHAR(0)`) can be used to mark the end of the name in `PATH`; otherwise, trailing blanks in the file name are ignored. If the `STATUS` argument is supplied, it contains 0 on success or a nonzero error code upon return; see `unlink(2)`. This intrinsic is provided in both subroutine and function forms; however, only one form can be used in any given program unit. ### Syntax | `STATUS = UNLINK(PATH)`
### Arguments type. | `STATUS` | (Optional) Shall be of default `INTEGER` type. ### Standard GNU extension ### Class Subroutine, function ### See also LINK, SYMLNK
